column2: CC, 55-64 Female  on Treatment for 10 years or more (Patient)
column9: I have used Fiornal for over 30 years.  Within 20 minutes I can feel relief from the pain and aura without side effects. Even with no negative side effects and great results while never exceeding the dosage, my dr.gives me a hard time with refills.  I also have FM with constant daily pain, with no meds. that help with that pain, so having something that takes away any of my pain is amazing.

column9: I have had migraines for the last 20 years.  The only medication that seemed to control it was Darvon (I can't take Tylenol). After numberous dr appts and prescritions, I finally went to a neurologist and he gave me this.  I had been suffering with a migraine for 9 days and within hours it was gone!  It was really a relief to know I finally had something to help me.  I wish dr.s didn't treat everyone as if they were drug addicts.  There are some of us who simply need pain reflief to function in our daily lives.  I would recommend this drug to anyone who suffers with migraines.  And I have had no side effects which is wonderful!

column2: b4theymkmerun, 35-44 Female  on Treatment for 10 years or more (Patient)
column9: i have been on every migraine drug under the sun, including schedule II narcotics, as will as triptan type meds.this medication ( without the codeine, which i am allergic to) works very well if a regular goody powder does not arrest the headache. it also stops the vomiting dead in it's tracks. it is a tried and true  "old school" drug. i take as directed. if i have a really bad migraine, will take two as the label says. would recommend for women who get menstrual migraines. a godsend for me. have been taking on and off since 1997, intermittently tried other drugs including stadol nasal spray, whenever i get a new doctor i tell them straight away, this is what works, please don't change up. hope this helps migraine and headache sufferers.

column2: MsCherokee, 45-54 Female  on Treatment for 1 to less than 2 years (Patient)
column9: Yes, Fiorinol/Fioricet work wonderfully for OCCASIONAL migraines, and this is how they should be taken. If you have 2-3 headaches a week, I would simply caution you about the seductiveness of these drugs, and the strong possibility of becoming addicted should they be used on a regular basis.  Also, be careful of rebound headaches if, for some unknown reason, you must take Fiorinol/fioricet. I have experienced this firsthand, and the headache pain you feel during withdrawal or rebound is MUCH worse that the original migraine.So,  great drug for the OCCASIONAL migraine sufferer!

column2: 45-54 Female  on Treatment for less than 1 month (Patient)

column9: I am a high-stress individual, and get tension headaches almost daily. Also, I get severe migranes about other week. column2: screen name, 35-44 Female  on Treatment for 10 years or more (Patient)
column9: Back in the 80's I was prescribed this medicine for migranes. It took 15 different trial meds to find out that this was the only med that worked in which I still function and feel normal. I later found out that I had Hypoglycemia, changed my diet and my migranes disappeared. As I got older I started having major PMS Symptoms in which 1-2 weeks prior to I had tension headaches, all over body aches and extreme fatigue.  I was missing 1-2 days a month from work and eventually had to start my own business in which I could schedule my appointments and work schedule around my PMS.  I went through a couple of years of trying different meds.  Finally I was put on Fiorinal and again it was the only medicine that worked. Instead of having 2 bad weeks I was down to 1 really bad day.  Fiorinal looses it's effectiveness if it is taken too often.  So I would highly suggest to take it only when needed and not everyday.

column2: Bella's Mom, 55-64 Female  on Treatment for 10 years or more (Patient)
column9: I have found this medication to be phenomenal in the treatment of migraine headaches.  I have been successfully taking this medication for 28 years, with NO problems whatsoever!
